summary: This document appears to be a transcript of questions and answers, likely from a congressional or oversight inquiry, regarding the Office of the Inspector General's (OIG) investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death. It focuses on the analysis of surveillance video from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on August 9-10, 2019, discrepancies in staff statements and video evidence, and the timeline of events leading to Epstein's death.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: A correctional officer on duty in the SHU during the night of Epstein's death. The document details her movements, statements to the OIG about counts and rounds, and discrepancies between her account and video evidence.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: A correctional officer who began his shift in the SHU at midnight on August 10, 2019. He and Noel admitted to prefilling count and round sheets and not conducting counts/rounds from 12:00 a.m. to 6:00 a.m.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who died by suicide in the SHU. The document details his movements on August 9, 2019, including being escorted to his cell and using a legal phone.

connections.description: Both were correctional officers on duty in the SHU during the shift when Epstein died. They admitted to prefilling count and round sheets together.
Noel was a guard responsible for Epstein in the SHU. She retrieved a phone from him and, according to her statement, was present when he was returned to his cell.
Thomas was on duty when Epstein was found unresponsive. He reportedly told Noel that Epstein had hung himself, prompting her to hit the body alarm.

events.title: Epstein placed in SHU and uses legal phone
events.description: Epstein is escorted to the SHU's G tier shower cell and uses a legal phone from approximately 6:58 p.m. to 7:19 p.m. He is later escorted to his cell on L tier at approximately 7:49 p.m.

events.title: Failure to conduct 10 p.m. count
events.description: Video review indicates Tova Noel conducted a round, not the required 10 p.m. count, by walking the SHU tiers alone. The last time a CO is seen entering Epstein's L tier prior to the discovery of his body is at 10:39 p.m.

events.title: Noel and Thomas fail to conduct counts/rounds
events.description: From 12:00 a.m. to 6:00 a.m., Noel and Thomas admitted to prefilling count and round sheets and did not conduct any of the required counts or rounds. Video shows little to no movement, with COs appearing to sleep at the desk.

events.title: Epstein found unresponsive
events.description: At approximately 6:30 a.m., Thomas and Noel were moving breakfast trays. Thomas found Epstein hanged in his cell. Noel activated her body alarm at 6:33 a.m. CPR was initiated at 6:35 a.m.

events.title: Epstein pronounced dead
events.description: Epstein was pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m. at NY Presbyterian Hospital after EMS transported him from the MCC.

locations: SHU (Special Housing Unit) at MCC New York
Unit 10 South (adjacent secure unit to the SHU)
L tier (where Epstein's cell was located)
keyFacts: The OIG reviewed the actual video recovered from the DVR system and found no missing minutes, contradicting public speculation about missing footage.
Correctional Officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas admitted to prefilling count and round sheets and failing to conduct any counts or rounds from 12:00 a.m. to 6:00 a.m. on August 10, 2019.

Video evidence shows Noel conducted a round alone between 10:30 p.m. and 10:36 p.m. on August 9, not the required two-person 10 p.m. count. The last visual of a CO entering Epstein's L tier was at 10:39 p.m.
The OIG's analysis was hindered by low-quality video with a partial view, making positive identification of individuals on camera impossible without corroborating documents and interviews.
The estimated time of Epstein's death is between 10:39 p.m. on August 9 and 6:33 a.m. on August 10, 2019. He was pronounced dead at the hospital at 7:36 a.m.
